caption: I went for the tapestries but the museum is really beautiful, a lovely, airy place with terrific pieces. Particularly stained glass and statuary.
I would not bring my kid there to play again. Not a lot of space, no grass to have a picnic on, dark and outdated.
Lovely place! And the gardens are quite and hidden. Small but cute.
Great place to see old roman ruins from around the 3rd century.
Pretty park but full of homeless people.
Small garden in street twisted cane furniture
Beautiful
This garden is long along the Cluny museum, there are slightly hidden benches perfect for a break in the greenery. There is a small playground in the center.

I recommend visiting. Very varied exhibition. There are even magic balls, unusual designs of various medieval religious objects, a surprising crystal cross or communion bowls, various storage boxes, and a bowl with angels for rituals. And the picture depicting the life of the Virgin Mary, all in royal lilies and with a lion from the royal coat of arms, suggests thoughts about the origin of the Virgin herself. Panel tapestries Ladies with a unicorn are a separate topic. I advise you to stop there to look at the details. Rabbits, foxes, birds... Everything is worthy of close inspection. It‚Äôs a pity that you can‚Äôt visit the catacombs under the museum, it would be very interesting.

Magnificent garden where you can rest and enjoy the cool air away from the heat in summer. At the same time you can dedicate yourself to visiting an ancient and stupendous palace that overlooks the garden.

The medieval garden created in 2000 is a contemporary creation of medieval inspiration created by landscape designers √âric Ossart and Arnaud Mauri√®res.  The garden is accessible from boulevard Saint-Germain, corner of boulevard Saint-Michel, boulevard Saint-Germain, corner of rue Du Sommerard.
Too bad the medieval garden part was closed. The alley is a little sad. There is a garden with games for children.
A splendid museum! The staff is pleasant, caring, great experience üëå‚ò∫Ô∏è ‚Ä¶
Between Saint Germain and Saint Michel, direct access by metro L10 and Rer B, calm ideal for a little reading.

Green and shaded stopover in the heart of the Latin Quarter, playing on the contrast of the garden with its modern layout, dotted with green spaces set up on terraces at the foot of the H√¥tel de Cluny. It is a small bubble with abundant vegetation broken down into several sections, allowing a fun stroll for strollers zigzagging between the beautiful flower beds and the plants used in the pharmacopoeia of the Middle Ages. All this just a stone's throw from the noisy streets of the capital, it's pleasant. It is juxtaposed with a children's play area surrounded by chestnut trees and benches opening onto Boulevard Saint Germain. Nice little park to discover in Paris.
Great place to Visit when you go to Paris, you learn a lot about life in the Middle Ages and the surrounding area is superb
Frigidarium with exhibitions relating to early Christianity but also an example of Islam
Superb park especially for eating an ice cream Bachir
Nice park, on hot days the trees offer shade and the setting is very nice

Very beautiful Buildings, very rich Museum, Very beautiful well-displayed collections, Very beautiful exhibition in TOULOUSE Middle Ages (It was the last day) Too bad the people of Toulouse were forced to travel there due to the lack of moving the exhibition to Toulouse .  As with many Museums, there are many visitors and therefore difficult access to the works on display. You need to allow at least four hours for a quality visit.

Honestly not great... We were looking for a quiet place to eat our Greeks, but part of the park was invaded by homeless people. The latter began to harass us while accompanying their remarks with derogatory terms. Another part of the park, however, was very pleasant, and there I had the opportunity to finish my sandwich in peace.
Very beautiful place!
Located right next to the museum, it can be a beneficial stopover for exhausted tourists. I found it nice but not very practical.

A pleasant place of rest and relaxation in the center of Paris, bounded on one side by the avenue Saint-Germain and the Cluny Museum on the other. There is also a playground for children, as well as a public toilet. Access to public transport. A few minutes' walk from Notre-Dame.

Rare to find this kind of place in Paris, very quiet place, it also allows you to be seduced by the innocence of children I recommend coming to visit it's really good for being calm especially since nowadays it's rare where you feel comfortable

The¬†medieval garden¬†created in 2000 is a contemporary creation of medieval inspiration created by the¬†landscapers¬†√âric Ossart¬†and¬†Arnaud Mauri√®res. No trace remained of the urban garden of the H√¥tel des Abbots de Cluny in the 15th century, although its precise footprint still remains perfectly identifiable from numerous plans and archive documents. In this sense, the contemporary garden, which places its axis perpendicular to that of the main building, expresses the exact opposite of the medieval party, which had a small garden, whose axis was parallel to the main building. If you go to Saint Michel Don't miss entering this mythical place, it's an ecstasy for the eyes, I recommend it.
A small garden where you can rest for a moment.
A delicious place isolated from noise by a hedge of trees, ancient walls, a clean place to recharge your batteries...
A small public garden welcome to take a break. Too bad it is so dirty and lacks maintenance.
Small, friendly park.
Beautiful green place in Paris
Always pleasant to sit there for lunch, or just to be silent and rest.  Be careful of the pigeons though.
Small garden next to the Cluny museum, but the medicinal plant garden has been closed for two years, because there is no money to redo the "floor" which threatens ruin!!!
Small park where there is a children's play area. The tour is quickly done.
